docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market returned to a more normal state during the past week following the confusion that existed in previous sessions. British pound sterling showed a steadier undertone while the Canadian dollar and some European rates turned...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market returned to a more normal state during the past week following the confusion that existed in previous sessions. British pound sterling showed a steadier undertone while the Canadian dollar and some European rates turned easier. Business transacted was moderate.

headline.main: Foreign Exchange Rates; Week Ended March 17, 1961

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was active during the past week. The trend was generally lower with the British pound sterling, Canadian dollar and other currencies showing losses.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 27 -- Uruguay told the General Assembly today that the United Nations force in the Congo had "guiltlessly" caused "exasperation" among the Congolese and should be gradually withdrawn.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., March 27 -- Uruguay told the General Assembly today that the United Nations force in the Congo had "guiltlessly" caused "exasperation" among the Congolese and should be gradually withdrawn.

headline.main: Uruguay Bids U.N. Recall Congo Units; New Agency Urged; URUGUAY BIDS U.N. END UNIT IN CONGO

docs.snippet: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, March 29 -- Leaders of eighteen Latin-American democratic parties, representing eleven separate countries and Puerto Rico, have declared their solid support for the principles contained in President Kennedy's "Alliance for...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, March 29 -- Leaders of eighteen Latin-American democratic parties, representing eleven separate countries and Puerto Rico, have declared their solid support for the principles contained in President Kennedy's "Alliance for Progress" speech made earlier this month.
docs.abstract: leaders of 18 Latin-Amer dem parties representing 11 nations and PR declare their support for plan; ex-Pres Figueres releases document

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 30 (UPI) -- Government officials denied today that they had looked the other way while the chief of the foreign aid program in Peru built up a $200,000 interest in a Peruvian cattle business.
